fields.summary: [scroll] Setting column to pinned messes up middle-mouse button scrolling

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
This was originally a bug about the scroll event not getting propagated to the window for browser scroll when the grid has scrolled to the bottom. The proper way to solve this would be to move away from the hacked mouseWheelScrollListener and instead move towards true scrolling on the pinned sections. This would be achieved by hiding the scrollbar only (not possible in IE, but possible to set width on scroll on all other browsers to 0px). So to fix this, feature enhancement - put true scrolling on pinned sections, just hide the scrollbars. ================ old JIRA description below ================ When you mouse wheel, the grid consumes the event, so the default window scrolling doesn't happen. Steps to reproduce ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.html
ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.js var columnDefs = [ {headerName: "Athlete", field: "athlete", width: 150, pinned: 'left'}, {headerName: "Age", field: "age", width: 90}, {headerName: "Country", field: "country", width: 120}, {headerName: "Year", field: "year", width: 90}, {headerName: "Date", field: "date", width: 110}, {headerName: "Sport", field: "sport", width: 110}, {headerName: "Gold", field: "gold", width: 100}, {headerName: "Silver", field: "silver", width: 100}, {headerName: "Bronze", field: "bronze", width: 100}, {headerName: "Total", field: "total", width: 100} ]; Now you'll be able to scroll up/down on the right (non pinned side of things), but not when over the pinned column
fields.summary: [scrolling] Change scrolling for pinned to use native scrolling, not the mimicked version.

fields.description:
Right now we just check for chrome. See github issue. 


Even though this was an on purpose design choice. 

From the docs at 13.3.0...

By default the grid will use the browser provided date picker for Chrome (as we think it's nice), but for all other browser it will just provide a simple text field. You can provide your chosen date picker to ag-Grid. This is done by providing a custom Date Component via the grid property dateComponent as follows:

fields.description:
when you refresh the grid, it stops currently editing cells from editing.

this is a problem if, eg, you are tabbing between editing cells, and you want some cells to change color as you edit (cellClassRules) so you call refresh() after the edit, however this takes the next cell you tabbed into out of edit mode.

Niall Note - i have asked the forum user if this is still a problem
fields.summary: Allow for refreshing not to impact currently editing cells

fields.description:
When you scroll in IE and FireFox with pinned columns, there is a lag in the scroll. Maybe there is a way to have no lag.

This is a big of a rabbit hole - all we can do is have performance improved to limit the experience. But don't think there is a real solution unless we change how the scrolling works. However this is a minor issue, so don't expect to change how the whole scrolling works just for this.
fields.summary: Have no lag with vertical scroll

fields.description:
See http://plnkr.co/edit/9pyyGuvIFctG7vwEYMHt?p=preview

If you edit the mood column (scroll right) then up/down will be output in the console, but home/page up/down will be ignored

We should allow the user to ignore all keyboard events I think.

Niall Note - the page up / down keys are not cell events - they are grid panel events - that is why they are not provided as part of this callback. To implement this, would need to reconsider the design, so the grid panel keys somehow also call this - which is a bit tricky, as the grid panel doesn't necessarily have an associated colDef.
fields.summary: extend suppressKeyboardEvent to page scroll events (home/end)
